alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 16 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pinal. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 157 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstormsSouthwest of Dudleyville and just southeast of Oracle. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The main washes of concern are Putnam, James and Dodson washes west of Dudleyville and the Ray Spring wash east of Oracle that drains toward the San Pedro River. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oracle, Mammoth, San Manuel and Dudleyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
